### <span style="color:#2E86C1"> hpiR  </span>

&nbsp;

**`hpiR`: House Price Indexes in R**

*<a href="hpiR_3.0_release.html">Version 0.3.0 Release Notes</a>

**Version 0.3.0.** This R package simplifies the construction of house price indexes in R.  Along with three approaches to deriving indexes, it also includes a suite of tools for testing index accuracy, volatility and revision. A dataset of Seattle sales is also provided with the package.

More information on the package development and vignette on using the package is available here: [Using hpiR](https://github.com/andykrause/hpiR/blob/master/vignettes/introduction.Rmd)

### <span style="color:#2E86C1"> kingCoData </span>

&nbsp;

**`kingCoData`: King County Home Sales Data**

**Version 0.1.0** This is a data specific package (R) that contains single family homes sales from King County, Washington (Seattle) over the 1999 to 2019 period.  More than 480,000 sales are included in this data.  The transactions and home characteristics are gathered from public sources and free to share.  The documentation functions explain each field. 

See the Github Page [here](https://github.com/andykrause/kingCoData)
